required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Exercise and Nutrition Interventions During Chemotherapy K07
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Exercise and Nutrition Interventions on Chemotherapy-induced Peripheral Neuropathy and Interoceptive Brain Circuitry

brief_summary.textblock: Chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy (CIPN) is a highly prevalent and severe side-effect of taxane chemotherapy, often used to treat breast cancer. Unfortunately there are very limited treatments for CIPN. This is a phase II randomized controlled trial to test the preliminary efficacy of exercise vs. nutrition education on CIPN, to systematically investigate the potential roles of inflammation and interoception, and to obtain data with a more accurate effect size to inform a future study.

study_design_info.masking_description: Assessor and investigator will be masked of Arms to the extent possible (i.e., for some outcomes e.g., biomarkers but not others e.g. symptom tests).

primary_outcome.measure: Patient-reported sensory symptoms of chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy (CIPN)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Time point 2 (approximately 6 weeks), controlling for baseline value
primary_outcome.description: CIPN-20 sensory subscale (Postma et al 2005). The subscale includes 9 questions, each rated 1-4, and the score ranges from 9-36 with larger values reflecting more severe (worse) symptoms of chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy (CIPN).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time point 2 (approx. 6 weeks) or time point 3 (approx. 12 weeks), controlling for baseline
Time point 2 (approx. 6 weeks) or time point 3 (approx. 12 weeks), controlling for baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Patient-reported severity of numbness/tingling (0-10). A larger value reflects more severe (worse) symptoms of chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy (CIPN).

secondary_outcome.measure: Sensory, motor, and autonomic symptoms of CIPN
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time point 2 (approx. 6 weeks) or time point 3 (approx. 12 weeks) or time point 4 (approx. 24 weeks), controlling for baseline
secondary_outcome.description: CIPN-20 total score (Postma et al 2005). The score includes 20 questions, each rated 1-4, and the score ranges from 20-80 with larger values reflecting more severe (worse) symptoms of chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy (CIPN).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time point 3 (approx. 12 weeks) or time point 4 (approx. 25 weeks), controlling for baseline
secondary_outcome.description: CIPN-20 sensory subscale (Postma et al 2005). The subscale includes 9 questions, each rated 1-4, and the score ranges from 9-36 with larger values reflecting more severe (worse) symptoms of chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy (CIPN).

other_outcome.time_frame: Time point 2 (approx. 6 weeks) or time point 3 (approx. 12 weeks), controlling for baseline
other_outcome.description: Leg strength via isokinetic dynamometer test

other_outcome.time_frame: Time point 2 (approx. 6 weeks) or time point 3 (approx. 12 weeks), controlling for baseline
other_outcome.description: Distance walked in six-minute walk test

other_outcome.time_frame: Time point 2 (approx. 6 weeks), controlling for baseline
other_outcome.description: Brain connectivity via functional magnetic resonance imaging

other_outcome.time_frame: Time point 2 (approx. 6 weeks) or time point 3 (approx. 12 weeks), controlling for baseline
other_outcome.description: Inflammatory cytokine concentration via ELISA (IL-6, IL-10, etc.)

arm_group.description: Exercise for Cancer Patients (EXCAP©®) involves face-to-face instruction and a prescription for an at-home progressive walking and resistance exercise program.
Nutrition education involves equal time and attention as the exercise arm, but the content covers nutrition for cancer patients and lacks an exercise prescription.

intervention.description: 12 weeks of at-home walking and resistance exercise.
12 weeks of implementing eating tips and tracking food.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria (subjects must…)
1. Be female
2. Have breast cancer
3. Be scheduled to receive taxane chemotherapy without other neurotoxic chemotherapy (platinums, vinca alkaloids, bortezomib, thalidomide)
4. Have at least six months life expectancy according to the patient's oncologist or designee
5. Be able to read English
6. Be at least 18 years old (no upper limit on age)
7. Provide written informed consent
Exclusion criteria (subjects must not…)
1. Be in the active or maintenance stage of exercise behavior (i.e., subjects must be sedentary)
2. Have physical limitations (e.g., cardiorespiratory, orthopedic, central nervous system) that contraindicate participation in maximal physiological fitness testing and a low/moderate intensity home-based walking and progressive resistance exercise program.
Additional exclusion criteria only for patients performing the MRI scanning (40 of 80 enrolled subjects)
1. Subjects must not have contraindications for MRI scanning (pacemaker, metal implants, pregnancy, chest expander from breast reconstruction, etc.—note that most port-a-caths are safe for MRI scanning)

reference.citation: Postma TJ, Aaronson NK, Heimans JJ, Muller MJ, Hildebrand JG, Delattre JY, Hoang-Xuan K, Lantéri-Minet M, Grant R, Huddart R, Moynihan C, Maher J, Lucey R; EORTC Quality of Life Group. The development of an EORTC quality of life questionnaire to assess chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy: the QLQ-CIPN20. Eur J Cancer. 2005 May;41(8):1135-9. Epub 2005 Apr 14.

patient_data.ipd_description: Interested researchers may contact the study PI with requests for collaboration.
